article:
United States policy in regard to biofuels, such as ethanol fuel and biodiesel,
began in the early 1990s as the government began looking more intensely at
biofuels as a way to reduce dependence on foreign oil and increase the nation's
overall sustainability. Since then, biofuel policies have been refined, focused
on getting the most efficient fuels commercially available, creating fuels that
can compete with petroleum-based fuels, and ensuring that the agricultural
industry can support and sustain the use of biofuels.
headings: [[Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007|Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 (EISA 2007)]]
Proposals in the 112th Congress on the United States
